headline: 2030 Alps Games already facing storm of internal controversies and public backlash
description: France received the Olympic flag on Sunday during the closing ceremony of the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. Behind the scenes, however, the handover has been anything but smooth, with multiple crises brewing and public resistance on the rise.

headline: Death of Fredrick Brennan, creator of 8chan forum where QAnon emerged
Top Mexican drug cartel leader killed
Understanding the battle of Verdun through rare or little-known photographs
description: A book published to mark the 110th anniversary of the legendary battle brings to light many images taken by army photographers. Le Monde is presenting several of these photographs, offering a glimpse into the reality behind this symbol of the First World War.

headline: Susan George, French-American political scientist and figure of the alter-globalization movement, dies
description: The essayist, co-founder of Attac, notably raised awareness among the French and Europeans about the damage caused by globalization. She died on February 14 at the age of 91.

headline: Hong Kong appeals court upholds prison sentences for 12 pro-democracy activists
description: The Hong Kong opposition figures had their appeals dismissed, with their sentences ranging from four years and two months to 10 years, in a ruling that highlights the severity of Beijing's control over Hong Kong's politics.

headline: Ukraine's Western allies push to drag the war out
description: All while sending weapons and declaring their support for Kyiv, Europeans and Americans have been tempted to play for time rather than push for a ceasefire. A truce would force them to deploy ground troops, and so they continue to rely on a war of attrition, leaving the Ukrainians on the front lines against the Russians.

headline: US Secret Service kills man trying to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate

New election rules spice up Paris, Marseille and Lyon mayor races
French artist JR's installation will transform Paris's oldest bridge into a giant cave
Park Chan-wook, director of 'No Other Choice,' still believes in the power of collective values
Donald Trump's support with 'bro culture' is waning
Iran-US talks expected Thursday despite fears of strikes
France aims to protect children from chatbots
New York's Mayor Mamdani orders citywide travel ban as major storm hits US

Is it ever a good idea to... wear artificially distressed clothing?
Karyna Shuliak was Jeffrey Epstein's last partner and main heiress. She won't benefit from his will
description: The Belarusian woman met the sexual predator when she was 20 and remained loyal to him until his suicide in prison in 2019.

headline: The Ukrainian family torn by war and exile behind a famous photo published by Le Monde
description: A few days after the Russian invasion, photojournalist Laurence Geai captured the farewell of a Ukrainian family at Odesa train station. Four years later, the mother welcomed Le Monde to Cologne, Germany, where she lives as a refugee with her son and her mother, far from her husband, since enlisted in the army.

headline: AI has arrived in France's local elections – for better or worse
description: From creating campaign videos to writing speeches, artificial intelligence has become an effective tool for candidates. However, it also raises ethical questions, prompting some elected officials to call for regulation.

headline: Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'What is, ultimately, the point of sending humans into space?'
